com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCListBindingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCListBindingData

  • public class YRCListBindingData
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this class provide binding, behavioral and name information about List controls.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      YRCListBindingData()
      Initializes a list binding data object.
      YRCListBindingData(YRCFieldExtension fieldExtension, java.util.HashMap setDataMap)
      Initializes a list binding data object.

      • getCodeBinding

        public java.lang.String getCodeBinding()
        Returns the xpath to the attribute that is used as the key to the description shown in the list box.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        setCodeBinding(String)

      • setCodeBinding

        public void setCodeBinding(java.lang.String codeBinding)
        Set the code binding for the list box. The code binding is used as the key that is selected when the end-user selects an option in the list box. This value will used as the output of the control. It should be the xpath of the attribute w.r.t. the list binding in the XML model being binded to the control.
        Parameters:
        codeBinding -
        See Also:
        setListBinding(String), setCodeBinding(String), setDescriptionBinding(String)

      • getDescriptionBinding

        public java.lang.String getDescriptionBinding()
        Returns the description binding for the control.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        setDescriptionBinding(String)

      • setDescriptionBinding

        public void setDescriptionBinding(java.lang.String descriptionBinding)
        Set the description binding which will be displayed to the end-user in the screen corresponding to the attribute in the code binding. It should be the xpath of the attribute w.r.t. the list binding in the XML model being binded to the control.
        Parameters:
        descriptionBinding -
        See Also:
        setListBinding(String), setCodeBinding(String), setDescriptionBinding(String)

      • getListBinding

        public java.lang.String getListBinding()
        Returns the list binding for the coltrol
        Returns:
        See Also:
        setListBinding(String)

      • setListBinding

        public void setListBinding(java.lang.String listBinding)
        Set the list binding for the control. It is the xpath to the repeating element of the XML model used to get the code and the description bindings from. The code and the descrition bindings are given relative to the list binding.
        Sample code: 
         YRCListBindingData bindingDataObject = new YRCListBindingData();
 bindingDataObject.setListBinding("XMLModelNamespace:/Root/Controls/List/RepeatingSubElement");
 bindingDataObject.setCodeBinding("@Code");
 bindingDataObject.setDescriptionBinding("@Description");
 bindingDataObject.setSourceBinding("SourceModelNamespace:/Root/Controls/List/@DefaultCode");
        Parameters:
        listBinding -
        See Also:
        setListBinding(String), setCodeBinding(String), setDescriptionBinding(String)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the logical name of the control. The returned value may be void if not set while screen initialization.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the logical name of the control. It should be a unique value across a screen and across a wizard (and all wizard pages)
        Parameters:
        name -

      • getSourceBinding

        public java.lang.String getSourceBinding()
        Retruns the source binding corresponding to the binding data.
        See Also:
        setSourceBinding(String)

      • setSourceBinding

        public void setSourceBinding(java.lang.String sourceBinding)
        Sets the source binding for the control. It is the xpath of an attribute from an XML model. If the value of the attribute is present in the the code bindings, then that particular value is selected by default upon screen initialization.
        Parameters:
        sourceBinding -

      • getTargetBinding

        public java.lang.String getTargetBinding()
        Get the target binding for the given control.
        See Also:
        setTargetBinding(String)

      • setTargetBinding

        public void setTargetBinding(java.lang.String targetBinding)
        Set the target binding for the control. The target binding is used to get the value of the control in an XML model.
        Parameters:
        targetBinding -
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.getTargetModel(String), YRCBaseBehavior.getTargetModel(String, boolean)

        public void setThemeName(java.lang.String themeName)
        Set the theme for the control.
        Parameters:
        themeName - Note: Their should be a theme entry for the theme name in the theme file for the plugin.

      • isMandatory

        public boolean isMandatory()

        See Also:
        setMandatory(boolean)

      • setMandatory

        public void setMandatory(boolean isMandatory)
        Set the property to true if the list box cannot have an empty selection. By default the propery is set to false.
        Parameters:
        isMandatory -
